newsitem.title: FRANCE: CSFB has Elf, Michelin as August French top picks.
newsitem.headline: CSFB has Elf, Michelin as August French top picks.

text.p: Brokers CS First Boston said in its August Western Europe share review that it had selected oil group Elf-Aquitaine SA and tyre group Michelin as its top French stock picks.
It said Elf was a good example of a company currently focusing on improving returns.

"We believe that Elf's current valuation, at a 20 percent discount to the sector, not only ignores its potential to improve but also does not reflect the company's current returns," the brokerage said.
CSFB said about Michelin that it believed pricing was currently stable despite a weak trading environment and was likely to remain so.

"We believe that higher net income and controlled expansion of working capital and fixed assets should lead to the generation of substantial free cash flow ober the coming years. We estimate that Michelin could reach its target of a net debt-to-equity ratio of 1 by 1998. We maintain our price target of 290 francs," CSFB said.
Its total French recommendations include LVMH, Rhone-Poulenc Rorer, Canal Plus and AXA because they are considered as value creators whose future value is not yet discounted by the market.
It also recommended Usinor Sacilor and AGF for their restructuring plans.
